metadata.title: CVE-2023-4622 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - high
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerability in the Linux kernel's af_unix component canbe exploited to achieve local privilege escalation. Theunix_stream_sendpage() function tries to add data to the last skb in thepeer's recv queue without locking the queue. Thus there is a race whereunix_stream_sendpage() could access an skb locklessly that is beingreleased by garbage collection, resulting in use-after-free. We recommendupgrading past commit 790c2f9d15b594350ae9bca7b236f2b1859de02c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-4622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 6.5.0-5.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 6.5.0-5.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 6.5.0-5.5.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 6.5.0-5.5.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 6.5.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 6.5.0-1002.2
No subscription required
